repnme.cdata!: Burkina Faso - Health and Nutrition Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Health and Nutrition Project's
            outcome is rated as satisfactory, sustainability as likely,
            institutional development impact as substantial, Bank
            performance as satisfactory, and Borrower performance as
            satisfactory. Three factors subject to government control
            were found to impede the execution of the project. First,
            difficulties in assembling a project management team
            hindered the start up of the project. Second, rapid staff
            turnover was found to be detrimental to the functioning of
            health facilities and to the institutional development
            efforts. More attention needs to be given to understanding
            and addressing factors contributing to the persistently low
            utilization of health services. Third, problems in meeting
            counterpart funding requirements persisted throughout the
            life of the project. The key lessons learned from the
            project can be summarized as follows: 1) Adapting flexible
            and decentralized procedures for channeling funds improves
            accountability, raise staff motivation, and improves
            response to local needs. 2) Focusing on improving quality
            and coverage is insufficient to raising utilization of
            health services. 3) Adopting a simple monitoring and
            evaluation system and ensuring that information is used
            strategically for decision making is critical to successful
            implementation of projects. 4) Integrating the project
            management unit into the government's institutional
            structure is essential to ensuring broad based ownership and
            project sustainability.

            HEALTH AND NUTRITION PROJECT

repnme.cdata!: Burkina Faso - Health and Nutrition Project (PDSN)

abstracts.cdata!:
The Health and Nutrition (PDSN) Project
            will assist the Government of Burkina Faso in its efforts
            to: (a) improve significantly the quality, coverage and
            utilization of basic health services for the Burkinabe
            population; (b) enhance the nutritional status of the
            population; and (c) develop a national capacity for
            achieving sustainable control of endemic parasitic disease.
            To achieve these objectives, the project will support policy
            reforms and investments designed to: (1) improve quality,
            coverage, and utilization of health services; (2) reduce
            micronutrient deficiencies; (3) achieve and maintain control
            of endemic parasitic disease; and (4) strengthen the
            Ministry of Public Health and Social/Family Action (MSASF).

docna.cdata!: Burkina Faso - Health and Nutrition Project (PDSN)

display_title.display_title:
Burkina Faso - Health and
